description: After the events of the 2nd season, Ai's three helpers, Ichimoku Ren, Wanyuudou and Hone-Onna live out their lives in relative peace. This is suddenly shattered when Kikuri returns to recruit them. Meanwhile, Ai mysteriously reappears from the dead and uses the body of a young schoolgirl, Yuzuki Mikage, to continue the Jigoku Tsūshin operation. Yuzuki is aware of Ai's presence however, when she can see what Ai sees.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Oiran
tags.description: Prominently features a courtesan character of the Japanese Edo Period.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

node.description:
[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/notomamiko/)

A Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. She is married and has one kid.

**Non-anime roles:**
- Shinano - Azur Lane (VG)
- Emma - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Skirk - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Durandal - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Jun Kazama - Tekken series (VG)
- Mother - Avataro Sentai Donbrothers (Super Sentai) 
- Rella Melancoryphus Cygnus - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Yi Xuan - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

[Website](https://www.nanakitade.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/PRINCESSNANA73) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/nanakitade_info) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nana_kitade/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/princess.nanakitade/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwzCuUrseqIMlWuICM1U_sQ)

Nana Kitade (北出 菜奈) is a J-rock singer signed onto Sony Music Japan. Nana is particularly famous for wearing Gothic Lolita fashion, something she has in common with many of her fans. She has become a fashion icon for many teenage girls and is popular in the Lolita subculture.  She writes all of her lyrics, while Susumu Nishikawa and Akimitsu Homma deal with almost all compositions of her music.

[Website](https://www.nanakitade.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/PRINCESSNANA73) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/nanakitade_info) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nana_kitade/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/princess.nanakitade/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwzCuUrseqIMlWuICM1U_sQ)

Nana Kitade (北出 菜奈) is a J-rock singer signed onto Sony Music Japan. Nana is particularly famous for wearing Gothic Lolita fashion, something she has in common with many of her fans. She has become a fashion icon for many teenage girls and is popular in the Lolita subculture.  She writes all of her lyrics, while Susumu Nishikawa and Akimitsu Homma deal with almost all compositions of her music.

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).

Hiromi Mizutani is a composer and arranger from Nagoya, Japan.  In addition to Zill O'll -infinite- and Yuusha 30, Hiromi Mizutani also composed music for the game Red Seeds Profile, known as Deadly Premonition outside of Japan.  He is a member of Team-MAX along with Yasuharu Takanashi, Kenji Fujisawa, Hiroshi Motofuji, Shuji Katayama and REMI.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡真里子)

Originating from Studio Live. Notable works as a character designer include [Jigoku Shoujo](https://anilist.co/anime/228/), [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) and [Nurarihyon no Mago](https://anilist.co/anime/7592/). Close friends with [Hiroshi Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/101189/), and often designs the characters for the shows which he directs.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡真里子)

Originating from Studio Live. Notable works as a character designer include [Jigoku Shoujo](https://anilist.co/anime/228/), [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) and [Nurarihyon no Mago](https://anilist.co/anime/7592/). Close friends with [Hiroshi Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/101189/), and often designs the characters for the shows which he directs.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡真里子)

Originating from Studio Live. Notable works as a character designer include [Jigoku Shoujo](https://anilist.co/anime/228/), [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) and [Nurarihyon no Mago](https://anilist.co/anime/7592/). Close friends with [Hiroshi Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/101189/), and often designs the characters for the shows which he directs.

[Website](http://www.konaka.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamaki_nyx)

Chiaki J. Konaka is a Japanese writer and scenarist best known for shows such as [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Digimon Tamers](https://anilist.co/anime/874/) and [Texhnolyze](https://anilist.co/anime/26/). He is also known to be the creator of Ultraman Gaia, as cited by Tsuburaya Productions.

Konaka's serious works generally have a dark, psychological tone. As a Cthulhu Mythos writer, he tends to add Lovecraftian elements to his works.

"Chiaki J. Konaka" is a very unusual name, as Japanese names typically do not include middle names. Konaka states that the "J." evokes the "Christian" name "John", due to him being born to parents who were members of the Anglican Church, but he does not identify as Christian. He began using the "J." at the age of 12, when he began making 8 mm films; he patterned the style after Western names such as "Charles M. Schulz".

He has cited [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) as his favorite screenwriting project.

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kawasak54965532)

Hiroyuki Kawasaki is a screenwriter and novelist.

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).
